alert.note: Alert for Cheshire; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:58PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Sullivan and Cheshire Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 157 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Bellows Falls to near Putney to near Heath. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Keene, Jaffrey, Charlestown, Winchester, Antrim, Dublin, Richmond, Harrisville, Nelson, Gilsum, Marlborough, Walpole, Alstead, Westmoreland, Swanzey, Marlow, Hinsdale, Roxbury, Troy and Sullivan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
